title: What channel is the NASCAR Clash race on today? Time, TV schedule
text: What channel is the NASCAR Clash race on today? Time, TV schedule for Wednesday's race The NASCAR Cup Series season unofficially gets started with the Cook Out Clash on Feb. 4 at Bowman Gray Stadium. After two separate postponements, the 200-lap Clash is set for a rare Wednesday event with practice, qualifying and the last-chance qualifier prior to the main. There is the chance of rain turning into snow in the forecast on Feb. 4, but NASCAR is prepared with rain tires for a wet track surface. Here's how you can watch Wednesday's race: NASCAR Clash TV schedule, start time for the Cook Out Clash - Green Flag Time: Approx. 5 p.m. CT on Wednesday, Feb. 4 - Track: Bowman Gray Stadium (0.25-mile oval) in Winston-Salem, North Carolina - Length: 200 laps, 50 miles - TV coverage: FOX - Radio: MRN - Streaming: Watch FREE on Fubo; HBO MAX app for in-car cameras (subscription required); NASCAR.com and SiriusXM on Channel 90 for audio (subscription required) The Cook Out Clash will be broadcast nationally on FOX. Other streaming options for the race include HBO MAX for in-car cameras for each driver. NASCAR Cup Series 2026 schedule All times Central. - Feb. 4: Cook Out Clash at Bowman Gray, Bowman Gray Stadium (1 p.m., FOX) Non-points - Feb. 12: America 250 Duels at Daytona qualifying races, Daytona International Speedway (6 p.m., FOX Sports 1) - Feb. 15: Daytona 500, Daytona International Speedway (1:30 p.m., FOX) - Feb. 22: Autotrader 400, Atlanta Motor Speedway (2 p.m., FOX) - March 1: DuraMax Grand Prix, Circuit of the Americas (2:30 p.m., FOX) - March 8: Straight Talk Wireless 500, Phoenix Raceway (2:30 p.m., FS1) - March 15: Pennzoil 400, Las Vegas Motor Speedway (3 p.m., FS1) - March 22: Goodyear 400, Darlington Raceway (2 p.m., FS1) - March 29: Cook Out 400, Martinsville Speedway (2:30 p.m., FS1) - April 5: OPEN WEEKEND - April 12: Food City 500, Bristol Motor Speedway (2 p.m., FS1) - April 19: AdventHealth 400, Kansas Speedway (1 p.m., FOX) - April 26: Jack Link's 500, Talladega Superspeedway (2 p.m., FOX) - May 3: Wurth 400, Texas Motor Speedway (2:30 p.m., FS1) - May 10: Go Bowling at The Glen, Watkins Glen International (2 p.m., FS1) - May 17: NASCAR All-Star Race, Dover Motor Speedway (2 p.m., FS1) Non-points - May 24: Coca-Cola 600, Charlotte Motor Speedway (5 p.m., Amazon Prime Video) - May 31: Cracker Barrel 400, Nashville Superspeedway (6 p.m., Amazon Prime Video) - June 7: FireKeepers Casino 400, Michigan International Speedway (2 p.m., Amazon Prime Video) - June 14: NASCAR Cup Series race at Pocono Raceway (2 p.m., Amazon Prime Video) - June 21: Anduril 250, Naval Base Coronado in San Diego (3 p.m., Amazon Prime Video) - June 28: Toyota/Save Mart 350, Sonoma Raceway (2:30 p.m., TNT) - July 5: NASCAR Cup Series race at Chicagoland Speedway (5 p.m., TNT) - July 12: Quaker State 400, Atlanta Motor Speedway (6 p.m., TNT) - July 19: Window World 450, North Wilkesboro Speedway (6 p.m., TNT) - July 26: Brickyard 400, Indianapolis Motor Speedway (1 p.m., TNT) - Aug. 2: OPEN WEEKEND - Aug. 9: Iowa Corn 350, Iowa Speedway (2:30 p.m., USA Network) - Aug. 15: Cook Out 400, Richmond Raceway (6 p.m., USA Network) - Aug. 23: NASCAR Cup Series race at New Hampshire Motor Speedway (2 p.m., USA Network) - Aug. 29: Coke Zero Sugar 400, Daytona International Speedway (6:30 p.m., NBC) - Sept. 6: Southern 500, Darlington Raceway (4 p.m., USA Network) - Sept. 13: Enjoy Illinois 300, World Wide Technology Raceway (2 p.m., USA Network) - Sept. 19: Bass Pro Shops Night Race, Bristol Motor Speedway (6:30 p.m., USA Network) - Sept. 27: Hollywood Casino 400, Kansas Speedway (2 p.m., USA Network) - Oct. 4: South Point 400, Las Vegas Motor Speedway (4:30 p.m., USA Network) - Oct. 11: Bank of America 400, Charlotte Motor Speedway (2 p.m., USA Network) - Oct. 18: Freeway Insurance, Phoenix Raceway (2 p.m., USA Network) - Oct. 25: YellaWood 500, Talladega Superspeedway (1 p.m., NBC) - Nov. 1: Xfinity 500, Martinsville Speedway (1 p.m., NBC) - Nov. 8: NASCAR Cup Series Championship race, Homestead-Miami Speedway (2 p.m., NBC) Our team of savvy editors independently handpicks all recommendations.
